required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trial for Shoulder Pathology and Pain in Chronic SCI
clinical_study.official_title: Trial for Shoulder Pathology and Pain in Chronic SCI

brief_summary.textblock: This research study will investigate in a 12-week home exercise program to see whether it is effective in improving shoulder pathology and reducing shoulder pain in persons with chronic spinal cord injury. The research study will involve ultrasound shoulder examinations of your shoulders using a non-invasive medical ultrasound machine, as well as clinical shoulder examinations and completion of a number of pain questionnaires.

primary_outcome.description: Quantitative ultrasound measures of the supraspinatus tendon

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in shoulder pain using the numerical rating scale
secondary_outcome.description: Numerical rating scale for pain intensity (0 = no pain; 10 = most intense pain imaginable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in shoulder pain using the numerical rating scale
secondary_outcome.description: Numerical rating scale for pain intensity (0 = no pain; 10 = most intense pain imaginable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in shoulder pain using the WUSPI
Change in shoulder pain using the WUSPI

secondary_outcome.description: Quantitative ultrasound measures of the supraspinatus tendon

arm_group.description: A home exercise intervention for strengthening and stretching the shoulders - Strengthening and Optimal Movement for Painful Shoulders (STOMPS) - performed 3 times per week for 12 weeks.
Subjects watched a 1 hour educational video on shoulder anatomy, mechanisms of shoulder injury and pain, and hints for managing shoulder pain

intervention.description: Exercises performed 3 times a week for 12 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Candidates will be men or women, 18 years of age or older.
2. Candidates must have an SCI and be at least 1 year post-diagnosis
3. Candidates must use a wheelchair (manual or electric) for at least the majority of the time.
4. Candidates must be able to transfer themselves without the help of others.
5. The presence of at least moderate shoulder pain (rating of >= 4 on a 0-10 rating scale for average pain intensity) for 3 or more months.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients younger than 18 years of age.
2. Patients who have a history of pre-injury rotator cuff tears or shoulder injury.
3. Patients who do not use a wheelchair (manual or electric) at least 50% of the time.

reference.citation: Mulroy SJ, Thompson L, Kemp B, Hatchett PP, Newsam CJ, Lupold DG, Haubert LL, Eberly V, Ge TT, Azen SP, Winstein CJ, Gordon J; Physical Therapy Clinical Research Network (PTClinResNet). Strengthening and optimal movements for painful shoulders (STOMPS) in chronic spinal cord injury: a randomized controlled trial. Phys Ther. 2011 Mar;91(3):305-24. doi: 10.2522/ptj.20100182. Epub 2011 Feb 3.
